IBM i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform API

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending the Intelligence Analysis Platform. It also describes the API of the Java client.

See: Description

Data 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.adminservice.transport
Contains classes for communicating information with the service that administers a deployment of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.transport
Contains classes for communicating information between the services that are responsible for data access on-demand solutions in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport
Contains classes and interfaces for communicating data with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating item data, for use in commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.
com.i2group.apollo.model.provenance.transport
Contains classes for communicating provenance information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport.unchecked
Contains a class for communicating unchecked data with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.security.transport
Contains classes for communicating security information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
Schema 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema
Contains enumerations that enable you to identify system-defined item and property types programmatically, and interfaces that provide domain-specific representations of geospatial values.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport
Contains classes for communicating schema information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
Events 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.cqrs
Contains interfaces for interacting with events and users in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport
Contains classes for the events that commands can fire, as well as classes and interfaces that define changes to the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating change information, for use in commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.
Common Functionality 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.common
Contains classes and interfaces that code throughout the Intelligence Analysis Platform uses.
com.i2group.apollo.common.tracing
Contains an interface that provides utilities for tracing code execution.
com.i2group.apollo.service.common
Contains interfaces and classes that all the standard Intelligence Analysis Platform services use.
com.i2group.tracing
Contains an interface that provides access to log4j tracing functionality.
Command Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform command service provides clients with the ability to execute commands that make changes to data, and to manage the leases that help determine which commands a particular client can execute at a given moment in time.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport
Contains classes and interfaces for commands that make changes to data in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.
Search Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice
The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform search service provides clients with the ability to perform searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport
Contains classes for the services that search for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.
Network Search Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice
The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform network search service provides clients with the ability to perform network searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice.transport
Contains classes for the services that perform network searches for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.
Index Admin Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.indexadminservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform index admin service provides clients with the ability to take a snapshot of the search index that can be backed up without being affected by simultaneous changes being made to the index.
Item Retrieval Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice
The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
Item History Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice
The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item history service provides clients with the ability to look at the changes that items have undergone as a result of edit and merge operations. The service also enables clients to examine the differences between two versions of an item.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that reports on changes to items in the Analysis Repository.
Purge Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.purgeservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform purge service provides clients with the ability to remove all trace of items and sets from the Analysis Repository.
Administration Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.adminservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform admin service provides clients with the ability to perform administrative functions on the whole system.
Audit Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform audit service provides clients with the ability to retrieve audit information about changes to items in the Analysis Repository.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves audit entries about items in the Analysis Repository.
Alert Feed Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert feed service provides clients with the ability to create, subscribe to, and unsubscribe from alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that creates alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.
Alert Retrieval Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve the alerts generated by alert feeds.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves alerts about items in the Analysis Repository.
Alert Feed Retrieval Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert feed retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve alert feeds and determine which ones they are subscribed to.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves alert feeds from the Analysis Repository.
Information Service 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform info service provides clients with a variety of functionality that is relevant to the whole system.
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that provides system-wide information for the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
External Data Services 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.delpsservice
The Intelligence Analysis Platform DELPS service provides clients with the ability to interact with data load ELP stage solutions.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.documentstore
Contains functionality for downloading files from external data sources.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.retrievalservice
An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve live information from an external data provider that has already been the subject of data acquisition.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetcreationservice
An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data subset creation service provides users with the ability to perform search and expand operations against an appropriately configured external data provider through the Intelligence Portal user interface.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetexplorationservice
An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data subset exploration service provides clients with the ability to retrieve information from a subset of data that has been created from an external data provider.
File Upload and Download 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.documentstore
Contains functionality for downloading files from, and uploading files to, the Intelligence Analysis Platform document store.
Extension Points 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertingapi
Contains a custom extension point relating to alerting.
com.i2group.apollo.itemstoreapi
Contains interfaces for simple interactions with events and the item store from server-side code.
com.i2group.apollo.securityapi
Contains custom extension points relating to security.
com.i2group.apollo.service.loggingapi
Contains custom extension points relating to logging.
Supplied Implementations 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata
Contains a supplied implementation of an external data subset locator that creates the subset to which it also provides access.
com.i2group.apollo.security
Contains supplied implementations of providers that help to determine what access levels different users have to different data.
com.i2group.apollo.useractivitylogger
Contains a supplied implementation of a user activity logger that performs no logging.
Data Acquisition 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.adapter
Contains an interface whose methods can be called by an external data subset creation service or an external data subset locator to retrieve data from an external data source.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.connector
Contains interfaces for locating, retrieving, and modifying the contents of an external data subset before the items in the subset are returned to clients.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.edrs
Contains classes and interfaces for retrieving data directly from an external data source in a Data Acquisition project.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.loader
Contains classes and interfaces for creating and managing items from an external data source in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.typeconversion
Contains classes that allow code in a Data Acquisition project to make changes to data that has been retrieved from an external data source.
Client 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.client
Contains interfaces and a class for interacting with the Intelligence Analysis Platform through the supplied Java client.
com.i2group.apollo.client.handlers
Contains classes and interfaces that provide access to information that is communicated between the supplied Java client and the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
Builders 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders
Contains interfaces for creating builders for creating objects of various types to be used in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue
Contains builders for creating property values of generic types to be used as item data in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue.typed
Contains builders for creating property values of specific types to be used as item data in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending the Intelligence Analysis Platform. It also describes the API of the Java client.

The Intelligence Analysis Platform demonstrates command and query responsibility segregation (CQRS). An Intelligence Analysis Platform web service can modify (write) data or query (read) it, but never both. The design has a number of consequences for the Intelligence Analysis Platform:

• Responsibility for creating, updating, and deleting data is separated into data-writing services that are independent from the services that read data. The data-writing services communicate changes to the read services using events.

• The command service, which is a data-writing service, has the following responsibilities:

   • Validating commands according to Intelligence Analysis Platform rules

   • Converting valid commands to Intelligence Analysis Platform events

   • Placing events in the event store

• The event store is an audit trail that contains information about every command and purge request (successfully) issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform. Each event also records which user issued the request, when they issued it, and where (that is, what IP address) they issued it from.

• Any read service, new or old, can be started or brought back up to date by replaying the event store.

• The Intelligence Analysis Platform does not use a single store for all data. Instead, data-reading services maintain their own data stores that provide optimum performance for their particular needs. Data-reading services populate these data stores in response to the events they receive. They are free to act upon or ignore events as their function requires.
